messages.subject: Re: Sit down meals
messages.msgSnippet: ... meal ... For years I made sit-down meals for my DH and DS. when my son got a little older, he would have something else b/c he is not much of a meat eater.
messages.messageBody:
> is there any time
> in your kid's life when you noticing them WANTING to sit down for a
meal
> with the adults?

For years I made sit-down meals for my DH and DS. when my son got a little
older, he would have something else b/c he is not much of a meat eater. When
my DH went on his current job, I didn't make sit-down meals when he wasn't
there, and my son loved it. He's just snack (good stuff, he eats healthier
than I do!) all day. Then about six months ago, he wanted sit-down meals,
even if it's only me and him.He was 16, is 17 now.

Hope his makes sense, I have a bad cold and headache. : )

Brenda

--
Brenda Potter Reynolds
www.bpreynolds.com

www.FingerLakesVacationGuide.com
